VT Notes: 3SquaresVT BBCE eliminates asset test; 185% FPL gross income threshold
Asset values not required for 3SquaresVT under BBCE
Asset verification not required for 3SquaresVT under BBCE
3SquaresVT: not applicable under BBCE. Vermont Medicaid Non-MAGI: standard federal resource limits apply.
3SquaresVT: always true under BBCE; no resource test
3SquaresVT uses 185% FPL gross income threshold under BBCE (lower than most BBCE states at 200%) versus federal 130% gross / 100% net
3SquaresVT: 185% FPL gross income test only under BBCE; no net income test. Vermont sets BBCE threshold at 185% FPL rather than 200% FPL used by most BBCE states.
BBCE removes categorical ineligibility for lottery/gambling winnings in 3SquaresVT
Follows substantialLotteryWinnings removal under BBCE
Vermont has obtained ABAWD waivers for areas with insufficient jobs; statewide or partial waivers have been in effect historically
Dr. Dynasaur covers lawfully present children and pregnant women regardless of immigration status. Vermont Medicaid covers pregnant women and children more broadly than federal minimum.

Vermont Medicaid (MAGI): 138% FPL adults. Dr. Dynasaur: 312% FPL pregnant women and children (one of the most generous CHIP programs in the nation). Green Mountain Care reflects Vermont's universal health coverage aspirations.
Vermont is a 1634 state: SSI recipients receive automatic Vermont Medicaid enrollment

VT Label: Medicaid for Working People with Disabilities Eligible
VT Notes: Medicaid for Working People with Disabilities: working disabled buy-in program allowing employed individuals with disabilities to maintain Medicaid coverage
Must demonstrate current employment for Medicaid for Working People with Disabilities eligibility
Vermont uses federal standard 60-month look-back for asset transfers in Medicaid non-MAGI long-term care eligibility determinations
60-month federal lifetime limit applies. Reach Up uniquely allows postsecondary education to count as an eligible work activity, expanding pathways beyond typical TANF work-first approaches.
Reach Up good cause exemption includes domestic violence per Family Violence Option
VT Fuel Assistance uses 185% FPL income threshold; seasonal program primarily covering heating season (November through May). Administered by DCFS (Department for Children and Families).

Critical winter heating need in Vermont. VT Fuel Assistance benefit linked to SNAP Standard Utility Allowance (SUA). Vermont's cold climate makes heating assistance essential; fuel oil and propane are common heating fuels.
Crisis fuel assistance component: emergency assistance for imminent fuel shortage or utility disconnection during heating season

Essential Assistance Allowance (EAA) amount: Vermont state supplement to federal SSI for aged, blind, and disabled individuals. Vermont is a 1634 state — SSA administers federal SSI but EAA is state-administered.

Emergency assistance administered by towns/municipalities (unique among states — most use county administration). Benefit levels and eligibility criteria are highly variable across Vermont's 246 towns.
Short-term crisis assistance for families with children facing housing loss or utility disconnection; state-administered by DCF.
State SSI supplement for aged, blind, and disabled individuals. Vermont is a 1634 state. EAA provides additional monthly income above federal SSI payment.
Required for all state-only programs; EAA requires SSI eligibility (age or disability)
Required for all state-only programs
Must meet SSI disability criteria for EAA eligibility (aged, blind, or disabled)
Income type required for all state-only programs
Income verification required for all state-only programs
Vermont uses 12 district offices (not county-based administration like most states). District office code identifies the administering AHS field office.
ACCESS Vermont system case tracking number. ACCESS is Vermont's integrated eligibility system for benefits administration.
Verification of Vermont residency required for all state-administered programs
ACCESS Vermont system client identifier; used across all state-administered programs
Added nepali|somali|burmese|swahili|french for Burlington refugee and immigrant communities (Bhutanese/Nepali, Congolese, Somali, Burmese populations) per Vermont language access requirements
